trans-unit.source: DNS Record Sets
trans-unit.target: DNS Record Sets

trans-unit.source: Enables you to manage DNS records within Azure DNS.
trans-unit.target: Enables you to manage DNS records within Azure DNS.

trans-unit.source: Records are grouped into sets called RecordSets, a RecordSet is the group of DNS records with the same name and type.
trans-unit.target: Records are grouped into sets called RecordSets, a RecordSet is the group of DNS records with the same name and type.

trans-unit.source: Common parameters and headers
trans-unit.target: Common parameters and headers

trans-unit.source: The following information is common to all tasks:
trans-unit.target: The following information is common to all tasks:

trans-unit.source: Replace {api-version} with 2015-05-04-preview.
trans-unit.target: Replace {api-version} with 2015-05-04-preview.

trans-unit.source: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription identifier in the URI.
trans-unit.target: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription identifier in the URI.

trans-unit.source: Replace {resource-group-name} with the resource group.
trans-unit.target: Replace {resource-group-name} with the resource group.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Using Resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Replace {zoneName} with the zone containing the RecordSet.
trans-unit.target: Replace {zoneName} with the zone containing the RecordSet.

trans-unit.source: Set the Content-Type header to <legacyBold>application/json</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Set the Content-Type header to <legacyBold>application/json</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Set the Authorization header to a JSON Web Token that you obtain from Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Set the Authorization header to a JSON Web Token that you obtain from Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>“Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests”</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>“Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests”</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: When using PUT and DELETE, an Etag can be passed in the HTTP headers to control concurrency behavior, as follows:
trans-unit.target: When using PUT and DELETE, an Etag can be passed in the HTTP headers to control concurrency behavior, as follows:

trans-unit.source: Header
trans-unit.target: Header

trans-unit.source: Behaviour
trans-unit.target: Behaviour

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: PUT always succeeds (no Etag checks)
trans-unit.target: PUT always succeeds (no Etag checks)

trans-unit.source: If-match <etag>
trans-unit.target: If-match <etag>

trans-unit.source: PUT only succeeds if resource exists and Etag matches
trans-unit.target: PUT only succeeds if resource exists and Etag matches

trans-unit.source: If-match *
trans-unit.target: If-match *

trans-unit.source: PUT only succeeds if resource exists
trans-unit.target: PUT only succeeds if resource exists

trans-unit.source: If-none-match *
trans-unit.target: If-none-match *

trans-unit.source: PUT only succeeds if resource does not exist
trans-unit.target: PUT only succeeds if resource does not exist

trans-unit.source: Tasks
trans-unit.target: Tasks

trans-unit.source: You can do the following with resources:
trans-unit.target: You can do the following with resources:
